intro: Connarus spanoghei, commonly known as the Spanish cedar, is a tropical evergreen tree native to the Caribbean and Central America. It belongs to the family Lauraceae and is characterized by its aromatic, reddish-brown heartwood that is highly valued for its durability and resistance to decay. The plant has simple, alternate leaves that are elliptical in shape and often have a glossy upper surface. It produces small, white flowers followed by dark, spherical berries containing one or two seeds. Connarus spanoghei plays an important ecological role in its native habitats, providing shelter and food for various wildlife species.
